intro: Thlaspi arcticum, commonly known as yellow glacier buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Arctic and alpine regions. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates. It produces small, yellow flowers and has a low, spreading growth habit. Thlaspi arcticum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in harsh environments.
